conclusion: Identify the objects and their corresponding shadows (A, B, C, D) in the image.
Determine the current position of the light source relative to the objects and their shadows.
Analyze how the shadows will change when the light source moves to the back right.
Consider the position change: As the light source moves to the back right, the shadows will shift to the left to maintain the angle of light falling on the objects.
Consider the size change: As the light source moves further away from the objects, the shadows will become smaller due to the increased distance between the light source and the objects.
A will move to the left and become smaller, B will move to the left and become smaller, C will move to the left and become smaller, D will move to the left and become smaller.
